name: Great Movie Quotes II Quiz | Which Movie | 25 Questions

questions.text: 'Nobody's looking for a puppeteer in today's wintry economic climate.' -Cameron Diaz
questions.explanation:
Being John Malkovich.

	Spoken by Lotte Schwartz (Cameron Diaz) to Craig Schwartz (John Cusack).

questions.text: 'I offered you the world, and at the first test of honor I betrayed your trust.' -Dougray Scott
questions.correct: Ever After & Ever After: A Cinderella Story & Ever After A Cinderella Story
questions.explanation:
Ever After & Ever After: A Cinderella Story & Ever After A Cinderella Story.

	Spoken by Prince Henry (Dougray Scott) to Danielle de Barbarac (Drew Barrymore).

questions.text: 'The jail you planned for me is the one you're gonna rot in.' -Whoopi Goldberg
questions.explanation:
The Color Purple & Color Purple.

	Spoken by Celie (Whoopi Goldberg) to Albert (Danny Glover).

questions.text: 'When you first entered the restaurant, I thought you were handsome. Then, of course, you spoke.' -Helen Hunt
questions.explanation:
As Good As It Gets.

	Spoken by Carol Connelly (Helen Hunt) to Melvin Udall (Jack Nicholson).

questions.text: 'Who knows where thoughts come from? They just appear.' -Rory Cochrane
questions.explanation:
Empire Records.

	Spoken by Lucas (Rory Cochrane) to Joe (Anthony LaPaglia).

questions.text: 'You're right, you're right, I know you're right!' -Carrie Fisher
options: Austin Powers: International Man Of Mystery
questions.explanation:
When Harry Met Sally...

	Spoken by Marie (Carrie Fisher) to Sally Albright (Meg Ryan).

questions.text: 'I appreciate this whole seduction thing you have going on here, but let me give you a tip: I'm a sure thing.' -Julia Roberts
questions.explanation:
Pretty Woman.

	Spoken by Vivian Ward (Julia Roberts) to Edward Lewis (Richard Gere).

questions.text: 'If you think that Mick Jagger will still be doing the whole rock star thing at age 50, you are sadly, sadly mistaken.' -Jimmy Fallon
questions.explanation:
Almost Famous.

	Spoken by Dennis Hope (Jimmy Fallon).

questions.text: 'I know something of a woman in a man's profession. Yes, by God, I do know about that.' -Judi Dench
questions.explanation:
Shakespeare In Love.

	Spoken by Queen Elizabeth I (Judi Dench).

questions.text: 'Cecile! Keep your legs closed! This isn't Jamaica!' -Christine Baranski
questions.explanation:
Cruel Intentions.

	Spoken by Mrs. Caldwell (Christine Baranski) to Cecile Caldwell (Selma Blair).

questions.text: 'Blane? Blane? That's an appliance, not a name!' -Jon Cryer
questions.explanation:
Pretty In Pink.

	Spoken by Duckie (Jon Cryer) to Andie Walsh (Molly Ringwald).

questions.text: 'I've never been alone with a man before, even with my dress on. With my dress off, it's MOST unusual.' -Audrey Hepburn
questions.explanation:
Roman Holiday.

	Spoken by Princess Ann (Audrey Hepburn) to Joe Bradley (Gregory Peck).

questions.text: 'Love to! Love the bags, love the shoes, love everything. Love to!' -Rupert Everett
questions.explanation:
My Best Friend's Wedding.

	Spoken by George Downes (Rupert Everett) to Kimmy Wallace (Cameron Diaz) and Isabelle Wallace (Susan Sullivan).

questions.text: 'We have so much time and so little to do! Strike that - reverse it.' -Gene Wilder
questions.correct: Willy Wonka And The Chocolate Factory & Willy Wonka
questions.explanation:
Willy Wonka And The Chocolate Factory & Willy Wonka.

	Spoken by Willy Wonka (Gene Wilder) to Charlie Bucket (Peter Ostrum) and Grandpa Joe (Jack Albertson).

questions.text: 'So I'm 40, I'm not married, I don't fly jets, and I don't have a dog? I grow up to be a loser.' -Spencer Breslin
questions.explanation:
Disney's The Kid.

	Spoken by Rusty Duritz (Spencer Breslin) to Russ Duritz (Bruce Willis).

questions.text: 'Well, I ain't sorry for you no more, you crazy, psalm-singing, skinny old maid!' -Humphrey Bogart
questions.explanation:
The African Queen.

	Spoken by Charlie Allnut (Humphrey Bogart) to Rose Sayer (Katharine Hepburn.

questions.text: 'His god...is God.' -Yul Brynner
questions.explanation:
The Ten Commandments & Ten Commandments.

	Spoken by Rameses (Yul Brynner) to Nefertiri (Anne Baxter).

questions.text: 'Put on your Sunday best, kids; we're going to Sears!' -Gary Cole
questions.correct: The Brady Bunch Movie & Brady Bunch Movie
questions.explanation:
The Brady Bunch Movie & Brady Bunch Movie.

	Spoken by Mike Brady (Gary Cole) to Greg (Christopher Daniel Barnes), Marcia (Christine Taylor), Jan (Jennifer Elise Cox), Peter (Paul Sutera), Bobby (Jesse Lee), and Cindy Brady (Olivia Hack).

questions.text: 'The son of my hated rival trapped forever in a river of death? Hmm...is there a catch?' -James Woods
questions.explanation:
Hercules.

	Spoken by Hades (James Woods).

questions.text: 'Blame is for God and small children.' -Dustin Hoffman
questions.explanation:
Papillon.

	Spoken by Degas (Dustin Hoffman) to Papillon (Steve McQueen).

questions.text: 'The weak are always trying to sabotage the strong.' -Reese Witherspoon
questions.explanation:
Election.

	Spoken by Tracy Flick (Reese Witherspoon).

questions.text: 'Pile up enough tomorrows and you'll find you've collected nothing but a lot of empty yesterdays.' -Robert Preston
questions.explanation:
The Music Man.

	Spoken by Harold Hill (Robert Preston) to Marian Paroo (Shirley Jones).

questions.text: 'A hit record is like stew. All the ingredients have to come together just right. Otherwise, it's just soup.' -Chris Ellis
questions.correct: That Thing You Do! & That Thing You Do
questions.explanation:
That Thing You Do! & That Thing You Do.

	Spoken by Phil Horace (Chris Ellis) to The Wonders (Tom Everett Scott, Jonathan Schaech, Ethan Embry, and Steve Zahn).

questions.text: 'Relax, would you? We have 70 dollars and a pair of girls' underpants. We're safe as kittens.' -Anthony Michael Hall
questions.explanation:
Sixteen Candles.

	Spoken by Farmer Ted (Anthony Michael Hall) to Bryce (John Cusack) and Cliff (Darren Harris).

questions.text: 'I don't want to be the materialistic weasel here, but do you think we'll get hazard pay?' -Steve Buscemi
questions.explanation:
Armageddon.

	Spoken by Rockhound (Steve Buscemi) to Harry Stamper (Bruce Willis).
